authorizePayment(TransactionManager.PaymentType, TransactionController, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse, PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>>) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Collects money from a customer using the current PayPal Invoice.
authorizePayment(SecureCreditCard, TransactionController, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse, PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>>) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Used to capture money from a customer using the supplied card data.

You can pass in a ManualEntryCardData object (derived from SecureCreditCard) to supply
unencrypted card data that was manually entered (via the UI), or scanned, etc.

You can also pass in the SecureCreditCard data the CardReaderListener's onCardReadSuccess API
might have sent you when a customer scanned their card.

The current shopping cart will be used.

This method can only be called after a call to beginPayment()
authorizePayment(CheckedInClient, TransactionController, DefaultResponseHandler<TransactionManager.PaymentResponse, PPError<TransactionManager.PaymentErrors>>) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Used to capture money from a customer who is logged into your store via the PayPal Location system.
availableReaders() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.CardReaderManager
Allows the app (or other SDK internals) to discover what readers are available.

B

beginPayment(BigDecimal) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Let's you start a payment for a fixed amount.

This call will:

- Cause TransactionManager's shopping cart to be setup to contain a single item with a fixed amount equal to the 'amount' parameter.
- If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

Normal payment flow is as follows...
1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
3) You can also optionally do things like:
- set the Invoice
- set TransactionExtras
- set the tip
- set the Signature.
beginPayment() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Let's you start an itemized payment

This call will:

- Cause TransactionManager to be setup with an empty Invoice
- If a card reader is attached we will start scanning for card swipes.

Normal payment flow is as follows...
1) call beginPayment() or beginPayment(amount)
2) The user can then swipe a card (if paying by card)
3) You can also optionally do things like:
- set the Invoice
- set TransactionExtras
- set the tip
- set the Signature.
beginPayment(Invoice) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Yet another configuration supported by the transaction manager to begin a payment operation.

C

cancel(DefaultResponseHandler<Boolean, PPError<PPError.BasicErrors>>) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.Invoice
Use this API to cancel an Invoice.
cancelPayment() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
Call cancelPayment to cancel the current payment.

What this call does is:
- Moves the TransactionManager into an idle state.
- Causes the TransactionManager to forget any Invoice, Signature, card data, or TransactionExtras data it may have been holding.
- Stops scanning for card swipes (if a card reader is connected).

Note, it is only legal to issue a cancelPayment between calls to beginPayment and finalizePayment.
That is because we can't cancel a payment before we begin it and we cannot cancel a payment
once told to collect the funds (finalizePayment).
cancelWaitForAuthorization() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.CardReaderManager
This is API is used by other parts of the SDK as well as by applications to indicate that we are no longer
interested in listening for authorization events (such as doing a card swipe)
The TransactionManager internally puts the CardReaderManager to "sleep" when a payment is cancelled or when the
application explicitly invokes the cancel APIs in the TransactionManager.
CardReaderListener - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The CardReaderListener defines callbacks that will be invoked by the SDK to communicate
important events related to the Payment Readers.
The caller of CardReaderManager API may be required to provide a valid CardReaderListener
object to ensure that mandatory events are handled by the application.
CardReaderListener.CardErrors - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
When dealing with cards we may encounter errors.
CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvent - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
When a Card Reader related event occurs your listeners will be passed an object of this type.
CardReaderListener.CardReaderEvents - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
These are the events you might be sent.
CardReaderListener.ReaderConnectionTypes - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The ways in which we can currently connect to card readers.
CardReaderListener.ReaderTypes - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The current list of supported card reader types.
CardReaderManager - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
CardReaderManager is the entry point for interacting with CardReaders used for
credit card processing.
The CardReaderManager lets the caller tap into feedback events from the underlying
Card Reader without having to worry about the finer details of how the card readers work.
Typically, application developers would want to tap into Card Reader related events together with
the TransactionManager related events to get more context.
CardReaderManager.ChipAndPinStatusErrors - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The list of possible errors when initiating connection with a PayPal integrated Chip & Pin card reader

ChipAndPinDecisionEvent - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
 
ChipAndPinStatusUpdateHandler<T,E> - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
This interface provides a callback handler definition and will be used by the card reader manager to notify the
calling application when a status update is available.
Unlike, many other callback handlers, the status update handler is unique; unlike a regular asynchronous call that
that notifies the caller once, this interface contains the APIs that will be invoked by the SDK to provide periodic
updates to the caller.
This interface is used specifically for the remote key update and software update workflow of the ChipAndPin based
card readerss
The update status handler has a well define flow: when the callback is registered while invoking the connectToDevice()
API, the caller will first be notified that the connection is initiated through the onInitiated() callback
If the connection was successful and no futher steps are necessary, then the onCompleted() callback will be invoked
and the updatedStatus parameter will reflect the current status
If an intermediate state is encountered - such as remote key update is required - then the onStatusUpdated callback
is invoked with the appropriate status code and display message
The caller is guaranteed to receive both the onInitiated and the onCompleted callbacks which is the final confirmation
of the status.
clearAllItems() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.Invoice

Invoice - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
The Invoice is a container for items that a merchant usually transacts against.
It is a helpful abstraction that keeps track of tips(gratuity), various totals (item subtotal, grandtotal, tax total etc).
The invoice object is filled with utility APIs to get various properties such as the quantity for
a given item, total of quantities etc.
Invoice.Formatter - Class in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain

M

ManualEntryCardData - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
ManualEntryCardData When taking a credit card payment where the card is not present this class is used to contain the card data.
Merchant - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
The Merchant object is an integral part of the SDK and acts as a single point from which all information about the
merchant is available both to the application and also internally to the SDK.
Although not provided as a parameter explicitly in every API the merchant object is critical to the workings of the
SDK.
Merchant.AvailabilityTypeEnum - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
This enum type indicates the availability status of the merchant, whether he/she is open or closed for business.
Merchant.MobilityTypeEnum - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
This enum type indicates whether the merchant is at a fixed location or is mobile.
MerchantListener - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
MerchantListener interface is useful for client apps that are interested in getting an updated
list of clients without having to explicitly ask for it.
To opt in into this feature, the application needs to initiate this mode by invoking the
registerMerchantListener and providing an instance of the MerchantListener interface.
If this listener is not installed, then the application determines changes to the checked in clients list
by using the getCheckedInClients API.
Sometimes, it is possible that some customers have been removed from the list and others added to the list
at the same time.
MerchantLogo - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain
This class is meant to provide the status of the addMerchantLogo and deleteMerhantLogo APIs.
MerchantManager - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The MerchantManager is mainly meant to perform merchant related activities such as:
> Initialize the SDK with the merchant credentials that would be used while making all the backed calls.
> "Check-in" a merchant based on a geo location to accept customer "check-in" payments.
> "Check-out" the merchant if no more "check-in" related payments are accepted.
> Set the merchant logo for other "checked-in" clients to see.
> Remove the currently set merchant logo.
> Get a list of all the "checked-in" clients/customer around the merchant's location in order to accept payments.
MerchantManager.MerchantErrors - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
This enum consists of all the different error types that would be returned by the SDK through the response handlers while invoking the merchant manager APIs.

at the merchant's location

checked in.

Information about when a payment is due.
PayPalHereSDK - Class in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The main object through which you can interact with PayPal Services and associated hardware devices
such as card readers and chip & pin devices.

There are three main APIs you can access:

CardReaderManager - Allows interaction with devices such as swipers and Bluetooth Chip & Pin devices
TransactionManager - Used to take payments, do refunds.
MerchantManager - Allows access of merchant info and discovering things like what users are checked
into your store and accepting payments from the same.

***** USING THE SDK *****

Here's how to quickly get up and running with the SDK:

1) Init the SDK:

Before using the PayPalHereSDK you must init it.

PayPalUser - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain

A base class for errors from the PayPalHere system.
PPError(T) - Constructor for class com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.PPError
Constructs a PPError with an error code from the provided type.

Here's an example usage of the constructor:
new PPError(BasicErrors.Success)

PPError(T, String) - Constructor for class com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.PPError
Constructs a PPError with an error code from the provided type AND a given detailed description.

reconstructTransactionRecord(String) - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.TransactionManager
deserialize the TransactionRecord from a given String

This method is a utility method to help with reconstructing a TransactionRecord based on a String that represents
a previously serialized TransactionRecord.
TransactionRecords are artifacts that the SDK emits to the app in response to payment requests.

Shipping - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.shopping
Contains information about the shipping cost and tax rate.
To create a shipping cost use DomainFactory.newShipping(cost, taxrate)
TaxRates used for shipping must have a name ("Shipping Tax", etc).
sIsSDKInitialized - Static variable in class com.paypal.merchant.sdk.PayPalHereSDK
 

T

TaxRate - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk.domain.shopping
TaxRate tracks the name, rate, and id of a tax which you might apply to a CartItem.
You may have several different tax rates (for example, a tax rate for food and a different tax rate
for gas).
TransactionController - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The TransactionController defines an interface that can be used by the application install a callback object that is used to customize behavior.
TransactionController.TransactionControlAction - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
Enums that are used to control the workflow of the callback APIs
TransactionListener - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
TransactionListener defines callbacks that will be invoked by the SDK to communicate important events related to the payment process.
TransactionListener.PaymentEvent - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
PaymentEvent Currently only provides the event type.
TransactionListener.PaymentEventType - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The Payment Events we'll send to the app.

Used to take payments, collect money, and process refunds.
TransactionManager.CancelPaymentErrors - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The list of possible errors you can receive when canceling a payment.

TransactionManager.PaymentErrors - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
The list of possible errors you can receive when taking a payment.
TransactionManager.PaymentResponse - Interface in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
When making a finalizePayment call you'll eventually receive a response.
TransactionManager.PaymentType - Enum in com.paypal.merchant.sdk
When taking payment you can specify what type of payment you would like to make.

W

waitForAuthorization() - Method in interface com.paypal.merchant.sdk.CardReaderManager
This API is used to indicate to the CardReader layer that the application is now interested in
scanning for card data through one of the connected devices.
